Articles.Content:
cannot be made more kerbal. except, of course, by being in space.

playing 40k.

Cannons shoot BD armoury rockets!

Using my phone... googleing the word "joshwoo69"

joshwoo69 plays KSP.

Thinking.

about the next rocket with a slightly lower chance of exploding

derping

Derping.

Save file editing.

Trying to use a NERVA to get to orbit

eating

Eating snacks.

skipping school.

with a "skipper" rocket engine

Planting a flag

Into solid Diamond.

Perform magic.

By summoning the Kraken to warp space for you.

Creating a boat

Creating a boat out of a ditched rocket because it's the only way home.

Using a calculator.

Kerbals do not have the concept of a calculator!

Planet busting

And chatting with Danny2462.

Ignoring physics

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ul6FXQMT1GI?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
, much like Danny2462.

Forgetting to post something for the next person because you were too busy dying in an explosion - the Kerbal way!

Now try... folding Origami.

Folding the very fabric of space.

Hmm... let's do... Constructing and Arc reactor.

> 
> Folding the very fabric of space.
> Hmm... let's do... Constructing and Arc reactor.

Constructing an Arc Reactor with the first 3 things you find on your shelf. Space tape, an uncooled nuke and a fellow kerbal.

How about... Building a computer...

Builds a hybrid of Glados, Skynet and Hal 9000.

Eating a hamburger.

Eating a hamburger at traveling to Jool.

Reading.

By the light of a booster

Using the toilet

and needing a vaccum to contain your... stuff.

Cleaning.

by sterilizing the germs with a rocket engine.

Browsing the internet

> 
> Forgetting to post something for the next person because you were too busy dying in an explosion - the Kerbal way!

Oops, sorry.

Browsing the internet while on a suborbital trajectory over the Sun. Just another tourist then.

Swimming.

Swimming through the old (pre 1.0) water you hit the water hard and die in a splash.

Sunning.

Moving a giant mylar concentrating mirror into position over the planet, increasing the solar radiation flux by a factor of a million. You're sure to get tan now!

Making maps.
